pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:0.4: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:0.5: 4. The second training rule on well-covered
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting in inhabited areas with their bodies uncovered. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.3.1: “‘I will sit well-covered in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.4: One should be well-covered while sitting in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, sits in an inhabited area with his body uncovered, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.11: if he has entered his dwelling;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.14: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.15: The fourth training rule is finished.
